body:
Washington (CNN)Ben Carson might be retired from medicine, but he's got just the cure for his growing fan base: new campaign T-shirts for $25 a pop.
The former neurosurgeon's Tees play on his medical background with statements like "I got a fever, and the only prescription is more Carson" -- referring to a Saturday Night Live skit -- and "Ben Carson Fever," done in the style of "Saturday Night Fever."
The most recent Monmouth University poll has Carson in second behind Donald Trump, who opened his online store last month. Carson is has support from 18% of Republicans to Trump's 30% in that survey.
Carson, Trump and Fiorina have recently witnessed a surge in the polls as more candidates back the idea of sending an outsider to the White House with no political background.
description: Ben Carson might be retired from medicine, but he's got just the cure for his growing fan base: new campaign T-shirts for $25 a pop.
title: Carson offers cure for Carson 'Fever': $25 T-shirts
